fields.summary: New task status field in task attempts table can lead to an empty web page

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Hadoop 1.0 JobTracker UI displays task status message when list of mapper or reduce tasks are listed. This give an idea of how that task is making progress.

Hadoop 2.0 AM/JHS UI does not have this. It would be good to have this on AM/JHS UI.
fields.summary: Task Status message (reporter.setStatus) not shown in UI with Hadoop 2.0

comments.body: you should check the AM UI?

Yes, that too. Attached two screen shots - one in the new UI and one from the old UI. You can see the "Status" in the Old UI screen shot, this gets updated as the job runs. For long running jobs, this is used by folks to see how much the job has progressed as updated by their code.
Tasks page
New task attempt page

Thanks Sandy for reviewing this. Max status length is a JobConf: mapreduce.task.max.status.length (512 by default). Note that this patch does not change whether the status message is sent in TaskReport. We only make sure to display it like in MRv1.
In that case I am +1 after the spacing change.
Adjusted indentation of second lines. Thanks Sandy!

Sandy, the test is obviously buggy as it is computing (start - end) = -elapsedTime, instead of (end - start) = elapseTime . It went unnoticed because in the current code start == end == 0
Makes sense.  +1
I just committed this to trunk and branch-2.  Thanks Gera.
